channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'We have to speak out,' Jimmy Kimmel says in his late night return
item.description: The comedian was suspended for nearly a week by ABC's parent company, Disney, before returning to airwaves on Tuesday night.

item.title: New York City may move its mayoral elections to even years. It'd be part of a trend
item.description: This fall, New York City voters will weigh in on a proposal that could move future city elections to even-numbered years. It's part of a growing trend...

item.title: Trump’s Big Flip on Ukraine, and a Defiant Jimmy Kimmel
NPR's middle school champion: A moving podcast about Japanese incarceration
item.description: For the first time, NPR's Student Podcast Challenge has a returning champion: a California fifth grader who explored a dark chapter in U.S. history du...

item.title: The Pentagon, the Press and the Fight to Control National Security Coverage
item.description: Journalists have long shaped history through scrutiny of the military. Now the Defense Department plans to cut off access for reporters who publish ev...

item.title: Typhoon Ragasa Kills 15 in Taiwan as Hong Kong Faces Strong Winds
item.description: One million residents of Guangdong, in southern China, were evacuated. The storm left 15 dead in Taiwan.

item.title: Typhoon Ragasa batters Hong Kong and southern China
item.description: Typhoon Ragasa whipped waves taller than lampposts onto Hong Kong promenades and turned seas rough on the southern Chinese coast after leaving deadly ...

item.title: The F.C.C.’s Brendan Carr Plans to Keep Going After the Media Following Jimmy Kimmel’s Return
item.description: While “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” returned to ABC on Tuesday, the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission has promised to continue his campaign aga...

item.title: Love pumpkin spice lattes? Learn some of its spicy history
item.description: For NPR's Word of the Week: Things are getting spicy. We explain how a word referring to cinnamon and pepper turned less literal by the 19th century.

item.title: Despite Trump, the World Isn’t Slowing on Climate, E.U. Official Says
item.description: Still, European nations are struggling to agree on how much to cut their greenhouse gas emissions, the E.U.’s climate commissioner said in an intervie...

item.title: Some Flights Are Delayed at London Stansted Airport After Small Fire
item.description: The airport’s security area was closed overnight to protect passengers from smoke. It reopened just before dawn, but a spokesman said there would be f...

item.title: Typhoon Ragasa Floods Hong Kong
item.description: Typhoon Ragasa, which caused death and destruction in Taiwan, skirted Hong Kong but brought torrential rain to the city.

item.title: Typhoon Ragasa Kills 15 in Taiwan as Hong Kong Faces Strong Winds
item.description: One million residents of Guangdong, in southern China, were evacuated. The storm left 15 dead in Taiwan.

item.title: Sinkhole Swallows Road in Bangkok After a Subway Tunnel Collapses
item.description: A burst pipe in an unfinished extension of Bangkok’s subway system opened a hole more than 60 feet deep in a road near a hospital and royal palaces.

item.title: ‘What Is the Purpose of the United Nations?’ Trump Asks
item.description: During a meandering address, President Trump questioned whether the United Nations should exist and criticized its member states on immigration polici...
